title: Balance - Wikipedia
cleaned_text: Balance Balance may refer to: Common meanings[ a film)](/wiki/Balance_(1989_film)), a short animated film [La Balance](/wiki/La_Balance), a 1982 French film Television[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=4)] [Balance: Television for Living Well](/wiki/Balance:_Television_for_Living_Well), a Canadian television talk show ["The Balance" (Roswell)](/wiki/The_Balance_(Roswell)), an episode of the television series Roswell - " [The Balance](/wiki/List_of_Justice_League_episodes#JLU18)", an episode of the animated series Justice Catfish and the Bottlemen Songs[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=8)] - "Balance", a song by Axium from Story Thus Far](/wiki/The_Story_Thus_Far_(album)) - "Balance", a song by Band-Maid from [Unleash](/wiki/Unleash_(EP)) - "Balance", a song by Ed Sheeran from [-](/wiki/-_(album))(Deluxe vinyl edition) - "The Balance", a Moody Blues song on the 1970 album [A Question of Balance](/wiki/A_Question_of_Balance) Other[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=9)] [Balance (game design)](/wiki/Balance_(game_design)), the concept and the practice of tuning relationships between a game's component systems [Balance (installation)](/wiki/Balance_(installation)), a 2013 glazed ceramic installation by Tim Ryan [Balance (puzzle)](/wiki/Balance_(puzzle)), a mathematical puzzle - "Balance", a poem by Patti Smith from the book [kodak](/wiki/Kodak_(book)) Government and law[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=10)] [BALANCE Act](/wiki/BALANCE_Act)(Benefit Authors without Limiting Advancement or Net Consumer Expectations Act), a proposed US federal legislation [Balance (apportionment)](/wiki/Balance_(apportionment)), a criterion for fair allocation of seats among parties or states Other uses[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=11)] [Balance (advertisement)](/wiki/Balance_(advertisement)), a 1989 award-winning television advertisement for the Lexus LS 400 [Balance (metaphysics)](/wiki/Balance_(metaphysics)), a desirable point between two or more opposite forces [Balance (stereo)](/wiki/Balance_(stereo)), the amount of signal from each channel reproduced in a stereo audio recording - The Balance, a personal finance website owned by [Dotdash](/wiki/Dotdash) See also[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Balance&action=edit§ion=12)]
